stories.text:
Please share tips or experiences related to vitamins/supplements

Vitamin A is pretty scarce in many diets, yet a 2010 paper shows that sufficient vitamin A produces 30% increase in ATP production. [0] ATP facilitates energy transfer between cells

Lots of sources don't seem to recognize the role of Vitamin A in energy transfer between cells. [2]

There are reports of Vitamin A supplements producing psychological productivity energy boost akin to caffeine. [1]

One cup of boiled carrots is sufficient daily intake of vitamin A. [2] Boiling the carrots increases vitamin A absorption due to breaking down the cellulose in carrots. [2] Collard greens are another good source.

Vitamin A is quite hard to get otherwise. It is in salmon and tuna, but you would need 4 servings per day to meet daily intake requirements. Beef liver or fish liver have vitamin A but who eats liver.

VitaminA Vitamin-A (algolia has trouble with "Vitamin A" searches)

[0]: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC2812036/

[1]: https://www.reddit.com/r/Supplements/comments/cxm1pg/vitamin_a_increase_in_energy/

[2]: https://www.livestrong.com/article/542992-does-boiling-carrots-destroy-the-nutrients/
